channel.title: What is a good book?
channel.description:
So i recently finished reading the Harry Potter series, and now i'm looking for an interesting book to read. I don't want an easy book but not an extremely hard book either, suggestions?
I've read books like: Nicolas Sparks', The Note Book and Dear John ect. No Worries (not a popular book). Bridge to Wise Man's Cover. Troll Fell.
I've read more but it is hard to remember names, any genre like those would be fine.

item.title: What is a good book?
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

The Belgariad and the Mallorean book series by David Eddings were my all time favorite. Highly recommend them

item.title: What is a good book?
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

I find books on programming pretty dull. Here’s a few interesting reads:

The Wheel of Time Series - Robert Jordan. (The author died before the end of the series, so the editor had to continue his work. It’s a huge amount of books.)
No More Mr. Nice Guy - Robert Glover (More for males.)
The 4-hour Work Week - Tim Ferriss (This one makes you question your lifestyle.)

Read full topic

item.title: What is a good book?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Can someone link me the pdf file for the 7th and 8th(not sure if the 8th one is released yet);o, tis pissing me of D:. (Artemis Fowl books)I’d appreciate it.
Aaaah, I remember like 10 years ago or something I had no idea what stealing was and I stole the first 2 Artemis Fowl books from Primary school x]. I still have the books to this day, the books are clearly aimed at little kiddies but the imagination that the reader produces makes the books good ;3 but I would never reccomend the book to another because its my childish side etc that enjoys it. Just read the 6th one today, got home from college read book ate read book;p.

Read full topic

item.title: What is a good book?
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

ytuio9`:

Well Inheritance isn’t an artemis fowl book if that’s what you mean, should’ve made that clearer. The last one I know of is the atlantis complex.

There was another book with life sucking parasites or something. I forget what it was called. Only a group of people could see them too.

Read full topic

item.title: What is a good book?
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

[quote=“B2300 T4nk, post:19, topic:436092”][quote author=Newty link=topic=538815.msg3942923#msg3942923 date=1331579195]
Read “The Giver”.

Awesome book.

Another good sci-fi book is “A hole in the sky” or “A tunnel in the sky”, I can’t remember exactly what the name is.
[/quote]I read The Giver. Shit, that book is bad. The ending ws weird. They should’ve made the story longer.[/quote]
They did you have to read the sequel lol.

Read full topic

item.title: What is a good book?
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Consider Phlebas, aaah its such a good book. I’m not into reading books tbh, I’m not even into the genre but it had some deep emotions etc in it and I really liked it.
I have no idea what genre you like but this book is woah for me, only thing is I don’t like how the series doesn’t carry on with the character:. Ah, the book has a kindof sad ending, I’ma read it since you’ve reminded me about it. Ahhh, if all books were written this well I’d be a book worm

.<.

Read full topic
